column1: 1 ^ Saepe expugnāvērunt mē ā juventūte meā
column2: dīcat nunc Isrāēl. ^ Often have they fought against me from my youth

column1: 2 ^ Saepe expugnāvērunt mē ā juventūte meā; etenim nōn potuērunt mihī. ^ Often have they fought against me from my youth
column2: but they could not prevail over me.

column1: 3 ^ Suprā dorsum meum fabricāvērunt peccātōrēs; prolongāvērunt inīquitātem suam. ^ The wicked have wrought upon my back; they have lengthened their iniquity.
4 ^ Dominus jūstus concīdit cervīcēs peccātōrum. ^ The Lord who is just will cut the necks of sinners.

column2: quī ōdērunt Sion. ^ Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Sion.

column3: ^ Let them be as grass upon the tops of houses
column4: which withereth before it be plucked up

column1: 7 ^ dē quō nōn implēvit manum suam quī metit
column2: et sinum suum quī manipulōs colligit. ^ who with the mower filleth not his hand
column3: nor he that gathereth sheaves his bosom.

column2: « Benedictiō Dominī super vōs; benedīximus vōbīs in nōmine Dominī. » ^ And they that passed by have not said
column3: "The blessing of the Lord be upon you; we have blessed you in the name of the Lord."
